intro: Podachaenium alatum, commonly known as the broad-winged podachaenium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, winged bracts that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in umbels, a feature common in the carrot family. Podachaenium alatum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
